name: Mercury
description:
Mercury is the planet closest to the Sun. 
It is small, with no significant atmosphere, 
 and experiences extreme temperature differences 
between day and night.

name: Venus
description:
Venus is similar to 
Earth in size, but its dense 
 and toxic atmosphere makes it the 
hottest planet in the Solar System.

name: Earth
description:
Earth is the only planet 
known to harbor life. It has liquid water, 
 an oxygen-rich atmosphere and 
a natural satellite: the Moon.

name: Mars
description:
Mars, the red planet, 
has giant volcanoes, valleys, 
 and polar ice caps. 
It may have hosted liquid water in the past.

name: Jupiter
description:
Jupiter is the largest planet 
in the Solar System. 
 It is famous for its Great Red Spot,
 a gigantic storm, and has dozens of moons.

name: Saturn
description:
Saturn is recognizable by its impressive rings 
 made of ice and dust. 
It is surrounded by many moons.

name: Uranus
description:
Uranus is a blue planet tilted on its side, 
which makes its axis of rotation unique. 
Its atmosphere contains 
methane, which gives it its color.

name: Neptune
description:
Neptune is the planet 
farthest from the Sun. It is blue, 
very windy and has 
a dynamic atmosphere rich in methane.

name: Pluto
description:
Pluto is a small icy 
dwarf planet located in the Kuiper Belt. 
It was considered a planet until 2006.

name: Moon
description:
The Moon is Earth's only natural satellite. 
It is the fifth largest satellite in the Solar System 
and strongly influences Earth's tides.

name: Io
description:
Io is the most volcanic moon in the Solar System. 
Its surface is constantly reshaped by giant eruptions.

name: Europa
description:
Europa has a smooth, icy surface, 
beneath which there may be a buried 
liquid ocean, making it a potential candidate for life.

name: Ganymede
description:
Ganymede is the largest moon in the Solar System. 
It is even larger than Mercury 
and has its own magnetic field.

name: Callisto
description:
Callisto is a heavily cratered moon, 
probably one of the oldest objects in the Solar System.

name: Titan
description:
Titan has a dense atmosphere and lakes of hydrocarbons. 
It is the only other known body to have stable liquids on its surface.
